_exec_summary.SummaryText:
SI Group, Inc. - Texas Operations - Freeport (SIG-FP) is a chemical manufacturing complex that produces a variety of alkylphenols.  Phenol is reacted with various olefins, including certain RMP regulated flammable chemicals (butylene, isobutylene, isoamylene) used as raw materials, to produce butyl- and amyl-phenol compounds.  The maximum on-site storage capacity for these RMP regulated flammable chemicals are:



Chemical    Max On-Site Storage Capacity (gal)    Max On-Site Storage Capacity (lb.)

Butylene        

   Single tank              50,000                                 248,275

Isobutylene        

   Sphere              341,233                                 1,675,456

   3 tanks each with:      50,000                                 245,500

Isoamylene        

   2 tanks each with:      30,000                                 158,100



Site procedures/policies limit normal operating levels to 85-90% in the tanks and sphere.  All three of these RMP regulated flammable chemicals are stored on-site in tank farm TF0, which is equipped with area gas detectors and a deluge system to ensure identification and response to emergencies.  All site facilities are operated in strict accordance with written operating and maintenance procedures 



There are no RMP regulated toxic chemicals on-site.



Prevention, detection, and mitigation of and response to accidental releases are accomplished through a holistic system approach involving several means including design, construction, training, instrumentation, process control, and procedures.



SI Group's systems approach ensures continual operational control and improvement by strict attention to changes in the operations through a MOC (Management of Change) process, a thorough review through PHAs (Process Hazard Analyses) of potential incidents that could lead to accidental releases, and verification of effectiveness of process control (LOPA - Layer of Protection Analysis).



Regulatory accidental release prevention programs with which SI Group Freeport com

plies are OSHA PSM and EPA RMP.  Actions taken for compliance with PSM greatly impact our compliance with RMP.  In other voluntary programs, SI Group Freeport is a certified OSHA VPP Star site and is certified to be in conformance with the American Chemistry Council (ACC) Responsible Care (RC-14001) Guidelines, which provide a systematic focus on environmental, health, safety and security.  Certification in these two voluntary programs serves as an indicator of the importance of these issues to site and corporate management.  SI Group Freeport also has its own site safety and environmental programs, as part of SI Group Performance System (SPS).  Engineering standards, such as ASTM and ANSI, are followed to ensure mechanical integrity in design and construction.



There have been no incidents involving RMP regulated flammable chemicals at this site that meet the requirements of 40 CFR 68.42(a) within the past 5 years.



The site emergency response program is documented in the Emergency Response and Contingency Plan (ERCP), which serves as a consolidated emergency response plan.  The site is also a member of the local Community Awareness and Emergency Response (CAER) organization and the Brazoria County Emergency Planning Committee (BCEPC) through which ER resources are shared and coordinated.  Our Emergency Response Coordinator regularly attends meetings of these organizations and also stays in contact with the Freeport Fire Department.  SI Group Freeport is also a member of the Freeport Community Advisory Panel (CAP) with meetings attended by the Site Sr. Director (Plant Manager) and the EHS Manager.  



The site has its own highly trained Emergency Response Team.  Training and drills are conducted in emergency preparedness and response, HAZMAT/HAZWOPER, medical response, and fire-and-rescue techniques (including high angle rescue) to ensure a safe environment for our employees and the public. 



The site has several Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) teams
which identify and implement improvements and provide a mechanism for continual safety improvement across the site.
